title: [$250] Automatically create a Markdown link when highlighting text and pasting a link

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from [this discussion](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C01GTK53T8Q/p1753136093215399) ### Background It's a common pattern that when a clipboard has a link copied to it and the user paste into a text window the link will be automatically formatted to hyperlink the selected text using markdown syntax (if the text window uses markdown syntax). Expensify currently allows markdown syntax in it's text window for chats, and we have keyboard shortcuts for making italics and bolding, but we do not have the equivalent for markdown links. ### Problem When users are use to markdown and expect the text window to work like other markdown compatible text windows (Slack, Github, etcetera) and it doesn't behave similarly it creates confusion and an appearance that our application is not feature complete. ### Solution Automatically replace text with a Markdown link when highlighting text and pasting a link. Example: https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/caf857d2-ee30-446d-80cb-7d040959d10f

title: [$250] Add a "Track Distance" option in the "Add Expense" menu

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

body:
When there is an empty report the user sees an`Add expense` button/option in: - The workspace chat - Reports primary action button - Report secondary action menu when there’s an expense added - And soon in the report empty state - being worked on https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/64730: We need to incorporate Manual distance creation into this flow by doing the following: - Add the `Track Distance` option to the menu and have it trigger the distance creation flow as outlined [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/18oJEJDDjA0-CUMofFewwjCaGv98cFetCrnk70ANNM-0/edit?tab=t.0#bookmark=id.1ya3yr7159zx) for the Manual and Map tabs. - Update the `Create expense` flow so that the create modal no longer displays the `Distance` option - as detailed [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/18oJEJDDjA0-CUMofFewwjCaGv98cFetCrnk70ANNM-0/edit?tab=t.0#bookmark=id.le2221p7wiyn).

title: [$250] Reduce test console errors

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
slack context: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C08CZDJFJ77/p1758194196572189 ### Proposal Initial effort to reduce test console errors and improve development workflow, with a batching approach for future cleanup. ### Background Our test suite currently produces 8,559 console errors across 186 test files, mostly React act() warnings. While all tests pass, the cluttered output makes it hard to identify legitimate issues during development. ### Problem When developers run tests to validate their changes, the overwhelming volume of console errors (8,559 errors) obscures real issues, which prevents us from quickly identifying legitimate bugs and reduces developer confidence in our testing feedback. ### Solution 1. Wrap Onyx operations in act() calls. 2. Fix navigation initialization warnings. 3. Improve async handling in tests. These changes reduce errors from 8,559 → ~3,167 (63% reduction). We intentionally stop here to avoid excessive mocking that could weaken test reliability. #### Next Steps We propose a batch-audit approach where related test files are grouped and fixed together. This keeps PRs small enough to review, but avoids overwhelming maintainers with too many submissions. We can provide a list of affected files, and contributors can pick up batches to continue the cleanup. This way, the community can collaborate on reducing noise without creating unnecessary review overhead.

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.15-9 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/69146 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdoijdsoisnjdssosd11@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Workspace has imported per diem rates and enabled Per diem feature. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to Workspaces. 3. Click 3-dot menu on the workspace. 4. Click Duplicate workspace. 5. Click Next > Continue. 6. Go to the duplicated workspace settings. ## Expected Result: Per diem feature will be enabled on the duplicated workspace. ## Actual Result: Per diem feature is not enabled on the duplicated workspace. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c7aedb7-4eeb-4396-ad1f-d71bccb4edef [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.15-9 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-825/folder/13176670/41237098/899329484 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdoijdsoisnjdssosd@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - User A invites User B to Workspace C. - User A creates another workspace - Workspace D. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. [User B] Go to workspace chat C and create a report. 3. [User A] Open the expense report created by User B. 3. [User A] Click More > Change workspace. 4. [User A] Select Workspace D. 5. [User A and User B] Open workspace chat D. ## Expected Result: The report preview owner will belong to User B. ## Actual Result: For User A, the report preview owner belongs to User A. For User B, the report preview owner belongs to User B. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57361908-9e15-4046-8b5d-63c930052e86 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @trjExpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Quality](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1758155073118119) ## Action Performed: 1. Migrated user clicks on a report result in Reports > Reports 2. The report briefly loads and then goes to NotFoundPage 3. User clicks Reports to get back to the list of report results 4. User clicks on the same report again 5. It loads correctly this time. ## Expected Result: Report loads without any error message on the first attempt ## Actual Result: The report briefly loads and then goes to NotFoundPage, loads correctly on the second attempt May be due to : "[Onyx] useOnyx returned no data for key with canBeMissing set to false for key reportActions_undefined" ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Edge - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
